body_html:
I agree. I currently have my logger conditional on the rank of the process, so that only the main process logs something whilenthe others don't do anything.

Another thing that is worth keeping in mind is that if you want to log losses, you'd actually want to store the losses from each process, or reduce the value of the losses to in main process before printing (but this would incur extra overheads)

Another thing that is worth keeping in mind is that if you want to log losses, you'd actually want to store the losses from each process, or reduce the value of the losses to in main process before printing (but this would incur extra overheads)
body:
I agree. I currently have my logger conditional on the rank of the process, so that only the main process logs something whilenthe others don't do anything.

Another thing that is worth keeping in mind is that if you want to log losses, you'd actually want to store the losses from each process, or reduce the value of the losses to in main process before printing (but this would incur extra overheads)
